Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class GraphicComponent

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AutomatonComponent
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.GraphicComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
State, Transition
public abstract class GraphicComponent
extends AutomatonComponent
This class defines components in an automaton that appear as a graph. For example, states and transitions are such components. Each component has an unique ID among components with the same type. Two components are considered the same if they have the same ID.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

      public static final java.lang.String ACCEPTANCE_CONDITION

    • getOpacity

      public int getOpacity()
      Returns the opacity of this component. If this component has no custom opacity, the maximum opacity #MAX_OPACITY will be returned.
      Returns:
      the opacity of this component

    • setOpacity

      public void setOpacity​(int i)
      Sets the opacity of this component. The maximal opacity is MAX_OPACITY. The minimal opacity is MIN_OPACITY . If the argument i is smaller than MIN_OPACITY , or greater or equal to MAX_OPACITY, then the opacity property will be cleared, that is, the default opacity will be used.
      Parameters:
      i - the new opacity of this component

    • clearOpacity

      public void clearOpacity()
      Clears the opacity property of this component.

    • getAcceptanceString

      public java.lang.String getAcceptanceString()
      Returns a string showing the positions of this component in the acceptance condition of the automaton containing this component.
      Returns:
      a string showing the positions of this component in the acceptance condition of the automaton containing this component
